Here's a link...  I was just reading through the classes based on
Vladimir's previous post...
 
http://junit-addons.sourceforge.net/junitx/framework/Assert.html
 
Enjoy!
 
Tom

	-----Original Message-----
	From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...] 
	Sent: June 24, 2003 1:41 PM
	To: junit@yahoogroups.com
	Subject: Re: [junit] Why no assertNotEquals()?
	
	
	No good reason. It just wasn't built.
	
	The solution is to roll your own or use a standard extension
like JUnit-addons. If Vladimir doesn't have it, then bug him to add it.
	
	For example, GSBase's BaseTestCase replace "assertSame()" with a
better failure message.
	
	Take care.
	
	>So said Leeuw van der, Tim on 2003-06-24 --------------------
	>Hi,
	>
	>I don't know if this is a FAQ; didn't find it in the FAQ
questions. But why
	>is there no assertNotEquals? In writing testcases for custom
equals()
	>functions I often need to test that 2 different instances
return false for
	>the equals() operator, so I occasionally have a need for such a
method.
	>
	>Regards,
	>
	>--Tim
